etymologies: Old English gē(a)r, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch jaar and German Jahr, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek hōra ‘season’

definitions: the time taken by the earth to make one revolution around the sun.
shortDefinitions: time taken by earth to make one revolution around sun

definitions: the period of 365 days (or 366 days in leap years) starting from the first of January, used for reckoning time in ordinary affairs.
shortDefinitions: period of 365 days starting from first of January

definitions: a period of 365 days starting from any date
shortDefinitions: period of twelve months measured from point other than 1 January

definitions: a year regarded in terms of the quality of produce, typically wine

examples.text: single-vineyard wine of a good year

shortDefinitions: year regarded in terms of quality of something produced

definitions: a period used for reckoning time according to other calendars
shortDefinitions: period used for reckoning time according to other calendars

definitions: one's age or time of life

examples.text: she had a composure well beyond her years

shortDefinitions: one's age or time of life

examples.text: it's going to take years to put that right

definitions: a set of students grouped together as being of roughly similar ages, mostly entering a school or college in the same academic year

examples.text: most of the girls in my year were leaving school at the end of the term

shortDefinitions: set of students grouped together as being of similar ages

phrases.text: in the year of our Lord —
